wikipedia_page.main: Gerry Blattner (real first name Gerard) was a British film producer who worked on many films produced by Warner Bros. in the United Kingdom.

link_mentions.page: BAFTA Award for Outstanding British Film

response: Of German origin, Blattner emigrated to Great Britain in 1897 aged 16 with Gustav Mellin, a fellow German emigrant."Louis Blattner", British Film Institute Film & TV Database, retrieved 10 February 2014Kinematograph Year Book 1929, p.268. Retrieved 24 January 2017 He had two British-born children, Gerry Blattner (born 1913 in Liverpool),"Gerry Blattner", British Film Institute (BFI), retrieved 8 January 2014 and Betty Blattner (born in 1914 in Cheshire)."Elizabeth Blattner", BFI, retrieved 8 January 2014 They both followed their father into the film business, Gerry as a producer and Betty as a makeup artist."Betty Blattner", IMDB, retrieved 8 January 2014 Ludwig Blattner never became a British citizen, and during the First World War he remained in an internment camp, which interrupted his management of the Gaiety cinema in Wallasey.History of Wallasey Cinemas Part 1 retrieved 22 October 2014 He married Else (also known as Elisabeth), the widow of Edmund Meisel the composer of the score for Battleship Potemkin, some time after Meisel's death in 1930, therefore Else was not the mother of Ludwig's children born in 1913 and 1914.letter from Jay Leyda , 17 December 1968, University of Minnesota Libraries, Arthur Kleiner Collection, retrieved 16 December 2016
